availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Henry C. Gassaway (Newport, Kentucky, produce dealer and provost marshal )

body.p: Campbell County, Kentucky, produce dealer and provost marshal. Maryland native. Married to Elizabeth Gassaway. Father of Rachel Gassaway and Henry Gassaway. Clerk in Campbell County in 1850. Produce dealer in Campbell County in 1860. Provost marshal in Newport, Kentucky, from June 5, 1862 until September 12, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 1A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Campbell County, Newport, 564, p. 564.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Campbell County, Newport, p. 385B.
“Letter from the Secretary of War Transmitting Statement of Expenditures for Army Contingencies for the Year Ended December 31, 1872,” Executive Document No. 118, p. 8, in U.S. House of Representatives, Executive Documents, 1872-73, vol. 8 (Washington, D. C.: Government Printing Office, 1873).
Kentucky, Wills and Probate Records, 1774-1989, Campbell County, Administrative Bonds, January 9, 1884 (accessed via ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "Henry Chalres Gassaway (1809-1883)," Memorial #22677360, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/22677360/henry-charles-gassaway (accessed September 21, 2018.
